info.description: This provides the REST API for admin operations
info.title: Pulsar Admin REST API

get.summary: Gets the rack placement information for all the bookies in the cluster
Gets the rack placement information for a specific bookie in the cluster

post.summary: Updates the rack placement information for a specific bookie in the cluster (note. bookie address format:`address:port`)

delete.summary: Removed the rack placement information for a specific bookie in the cluster

get.summary: Get the stats for the Netty allocator. Available allocators are 'default' and 'ml-cache'
Get pending bookie client op stats by namesapce

get.description:
This API gives the current broker availability in percent, each resource percentage usage is calculated and thensum of all of the resource usage percent is called broker-resource-availability

THIS API IS ONLY FOR USE BY TESTING FOR CONFIRMING NAMESPACE ALLOCATION ALGORITHM
get.summary: Broker availability report
Get Load for this broker
Get all the mbean details of this broker JVM

get.description: Requested should be executed by Monitoring agent on each broker to fetch the metrics
get.summary: Gets the metrics for Monitoring
Get all the topic stats by namespace
An REST endpoint to trigger backlogQuotaCheck
Get all updatable dynamic configurations's name

403.description: You don't have admin permission to get configuration

get.description: A negative value denotes that deletion has been completely disabled. 'null' denotes that the topics in the namespace will fall back to the broker default for deletion lag.
get.summary: Number of milliseconds to wait before deleting a ledger segment which has been offloaded from the Pulsar cluster's local storage (i.e. BookKeeper)

put.description: A negative value disables the deletion completely.
put.summary: Set number of milliseconds to wait before deleting a ledger segment which has been offloaded from the Pulsar cluster's local storage (i.e. BookKeeper)

parameters.description: New number of milliseconds to wait before deleting a ledger segment which has been offloaded
parameters.name: body

delete.summary: Clear the namespace configured offload deletion lag. The topics in the namespace will fallback to using the default configured deletion lag for the broker

get.description: A negative value disables automatic offloading
get.summary: Maximum number of bytes stored on the pulsar cluster for a topic, before the broker will start offloading to longterm storage

put.description: -1 will revert to using the cluster default. A negative value disables automatic offloading.

get.description: If the flag is set to true, when a producer without a schema attempts to produce to a topic with schema in this namespace, the producer will be failed to connect. PLEASE be carefully on using this, since non-java clients don't support schema.if you enable this setting, it will cause non-java clients failed to produce.
get.summary: Get schema validation enforced flag for namespace.

post.description: If the flag is set to true, when a producer without a schema attempts to produce to a topic with schema in this namespace, the producer will be failed to connect. PLEASE be carefully on using this, since non-java clients don't support schema.if you enable this setting, it will cause non-java clients failed to produce.

parameters.description: Flag of whether validation is enforced on the specified namespace

put.description: Unload an active namespace from the current broker serving it. Performing this operation will let the brokerremoves all producers, consumers, and connections using this namespace, and close all topics (includingtheir persistent store). During that operation, the namespace is marked as tentatively unavailable until thebroker completes the unloading action. This operation requires strictly super user privileges, since it wouldresult in non-persistent message loss and unexpected connection closure to the clients.
put.summary: Unload namespace

AutoFailoverPolicyData.description: The auto failover policy configuration data

parameters.description:
The parameters applied to the auto failover policy specified by `policy_type`.
The parameters for 'min_available' are :
  - 'min_limit': the limit of minimal number of available brokers in primary group before auto failover
  - 'usage_threshold': the resource usage threshold. If the usage of a broker is beyond this value, it would be marked as unavailable

BrokerNamespaceIsolationData.description: The namespace isolation data for a given broker

namespaceRegex.description: The namespace-isolation policies attached to this broker

ClusterData.description: The configuration data for a cluster

brokerServiceUrl.description: The broker service url (for produce and consume operations)

brokerServiceUrlTls.description: The secured broker service url (for produce and consume operations)

peerClusterNames.description: A set of peer cluster names

proxyProtocol.description: protocol to decide type of proxy routing eg: SNI-routing

proxyServiceUrl.description: Proxy-service url when client would like to connect to broker via proxy.

serviceUrl.description: The HTTP rest service URL (for admin operations)

serviceUrlTls.description: The HTTPS rest service URL (for admin operations)

FailureDomain.description: The data of a failure domain configuration in a cluster

brokers.description: The collection of brokers in the same failure domain

NamespaceIsolationData.description: The data of namespace isolation configuration

auto_failover_policy.description: The data of auto-failover policy configuration

namespaces.description: The list of namespaces to apply this namespace isolation data

primary.description: The list of secondary brokers for serving the list of namespaces in this isolation policy

TenantInfo.description: Information of adminRoles and allowedClusters for tenant

adminRoles.description: Comma separated list of auth principal allowed to administrate the tenant.
